skill.name: explain-expert
skill.description: Analyze codebases and provide technical overviews covering core components, interactions, deployment architecture, and runtime behavior. Use when the user asks for codebase analysis, project overview, technical architecture explanation, or system documentation.
skill.summary: Analyze codebases and provide technical overviews covering core components, interactions, deployment...
skill.author: nexteacc

security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill containing analysis framework instructions. No executable code, network operations, file writes, or external commands. Static analysis findings are false positives from naive pattern matching on documentation text. The skill is a legitimate documentation framework with no malicious patterns or harmful intent.

content.value_statement: This skill provides a structured framework for analyzing codebases. It helps developers quickly understand unfamiliar projects by examining structure, dependencies, and architecture. The analysis covers components, interactions, deployment, and runtime behavior.
actual_capabilities: Scan repository structure to identify main directories and entry points
Read configuration files like package.json and Docker files
Map external libraries and frameworks used in the project
Trace application execution flow and request handling
Describe component interactions and data flow
Summarize deployment architecture and infrastructure details
limitations: Does not modify code or files
Does not execute code or run tests
Does not provide implementation suggestions unless asked
Does not access external APIs or network resources

use_cases.title: Onboard to codebase
use_cases.description: New team members quickly understand project structure and architecture

use_cases.title: Generate documentation
use_cases.description: Create initial technical documentation from codebase analysis

use_cases.title: Review system design
use_cases.description: Understand existing system interactions and deployment patterns

prompt_templates.title: Basic overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain this codebase structure. What are the main components and how do they interact?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture deep dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the deployment architecture and runtime behavior of this application.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: What frameworks and libraries does this project use? Map the key dependencies.

prompt_templates.title: Full documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide comprehensive technical documentation including: repository structure, core components, component interactions, deployment setup, and runtime behavior.

output_examples.input: Explain this codebase structure. What are the main components and how do they interact?
output: Repository structure shows a standard layout with src/, tests/, and config/ directories
Main components: API server, database layer, and authentication service
Components communicate via REST APIs with dependency injection pattern
Entry point is index.js which initializes the Express server
Build process uses webpack for bundling and Docker for containerization

output_examples.input: Analyze the deployment architecture and runtime behavior
output: Application uses Docker for containerization with environment-specific configurations
Runtime starts with index.js which initializes the Express server and database connection
Request handling follows: client -> load balancer -> API gateway -> service layer -> database
Background tasks are managed by a job queue with Redis as the message broker

best_practices: Start by scanning repository structure before diving into code details
Identify configuration files early to understand build and deployment requirements
Follow execution flow from entry point to understand request handling
anti_patterns: Avoid giving personal opinions on code quality unless asked
Do not suggest implementation changes during analysis
Do not skip reading configuration files before source code

faq.question: What does this skill analyze?
faq.answer: It examines repository structure, configuration files, dependencies, components, and their interactions.

faq.question: Does it modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No, this skill only reads files to provide analysis. It never writes or changes code.

faq.question: Can it analyze any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes, the framework works for any codebase regardless of language or framework.

faq.question: Does it run my code?
faq.answer: No, it reads files statically without executing any code or tests.

faq.question: What output formats are supported?
faq.answer: Returns structured markdown descriptions suitable for documentation or further processing.

faq.question: How long does analysis take?
faq.answer: Time varies with codebase size. The skill reads key files first then provides comprehensive overview.
